data.title: Lonely Shades – Silicon Valley International Contemporary Art Exhibition
data.text:
Opportunity Description

International Deadline: May 3, 2024 – Gallery NAT is pleased to announce the event “Lonely Shades – Silicon Valley International Contemporary Art Exhibition” to be held from March 26 to April 06, 2024 at our partner ArtX Gallery in Fremont, San Francisco Bay Area, California, USA.

In Silicon Valley, the technological heart of the United States, we are about to embark on an unprecedented artistic journey – “Lonely Shades – Silicon Valley International Contemporary Art Exhibition”. The exhibition aims to explore how loneliness, as a universal human experience, reveals its profound social and philosophical significance under the artists’ brushstrokes, and how it affects our relationship with ourselves, each other, and even the world.

Lonely Shades – Silicon Valley International Contemporary Art Exhibition​ welcomes contemporary artists and audiences from around the globe to explore the universal and complex theme of loneliness across cultural and geographic boundaries. In this artistic journey, we not only expect each participant to discover the beauty and meaning in the artworks, but we also hope that this exhibition will inspire deeper reflection on humanity, society, and the world we all live in. In this era of challenges and possibilities, let us find connection, understanding and hope together through the power of art.

ELIGIBILITY

Artists should be at least 18 years old by the time of submission. We welcome artists of all nationalities. Open to all media included, painting, print, watercolour, sculpture, photography, video art, installation, etc. All works must be original.

FEES

There is no submission fee. However, we ask all the selected artists to pay a $300 participation fee. The fee includes: Media promotion, exhibition venue fee, opening ceremony, artwork mantling/dismantling

​APPLICATION

Easy Application by email, visit us online for details. Each artist could submit 1-4 artworks. However, the longest side of the artworks combined must be within 100cm.

About:

Gallery NAT is a non-profit mobile gallery active in international events and exhibitions. At present, Gallery NAT represents more than 30 contemporary artists around the world, and we continue to support new and outstanding young artists.

Our curatorial team is jointly built by a group of curators based in the US, UK, France, Spain, and China. We have participated in the New York Art Fair, the Los Angeles Art Fair, and the San Diego Art Fair in the United States; the Grand Palais Museum Salon and the Louvre Art Fair in France, the London Art Fair in the United Kingdom and Italy Art Fair in Italy.

Gallery NAT curates exhibitions in New York, Paris, London, Venice, Shanghai, Tokyo, and other cities every year to support young artists in Europe, North America, and Asia, hoping to nourish and discover more talented and outstanding artists.​
